com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain.shopping
Interface ShoppingCart

public interface ShoppingCart

A container of CartItems.
It also tracks the tip that might be set for this purchase.
It can tell you the subtotal, tax total, grand total.
Also allows you to set/get the quantity of each item in the shopping cart.

Method Detail

getGrandTotal

BigDecimal getGrandTotal()
Returns the current grand total taking into account all the cart items, any tip that has been added, any discount that's been applied, and the tax total (if taxes are enabled).

Returns:
A BigDecimal representing the value of the shopping cart. Units are based on the CartItem units.

getSubTotal

BigDecimal getSubTotal()
Returns the total value of all the cart items. Takes into account the quantity of each item. This call does not consider any tax nor does it consider any tip that might be present.

Returns:
A BigDecimal representing the value of the shopping cart items. Units are based on the CartItem units.

getDiscount

Discount getDiscount()
Returns any Discount that has been applied.

Returns:
A Discount object describing the magnitude & type of the discount.

setDiscount

void setDiscount(Discount discount)
Allows you to set a discount to be used with this cart.

Parameters:
discount - A Discount object describing the magitude & type of the discount.

getDiscountedAmount

BigDecimal getDiscountedAmount()
Returns the discount as a value only.

Returns:
A BigDecimal that equals the value used when the Discount was first set.

getTipAmount

BigDecimal getTipAmount()
Returns the value of the tip that was applied to this cart.

Returns:
A BigDecimal describing the magnitude of the tip that was previously set on this cart.

setTipAmount

void setTipAmount(BigDecimal tip)
Allows you to set a tip amount to use with this cart.

Parameters:
tip - A BigDecimal representing the amount of tip to set.

getTaxEnabled

boolean getTaxEnabled()
Determine if the tax amount should be added to the grand total.

Returns:
true if tax will be added to the grand total.

long getTotalOfAllQuantitiesInCart()
Returns the total number of items in a cart. This call takes into account the quantity of each item.

setQuantityForItem

void setQuantityForItem(CartItem item,
                        long newQuantity)
Adjust the quantity of an item in the cart. If quantity is less than 1 we'll remove the item from the cart.

Parameters:
item -
newQuantity -

addItem

void addItem(CartItem item,
             long quantityToAdd)
Add a shopping cart item to the list with the given quantity. If you add an item that is already in the shopping cart we'll change the quantity of that item by the amount specified in newQuantity. For example, if you have 4 apples already in the shopping cart, and you call addItem(appleItem, 6) there will now be 10 apples in the shopping cart. Negative values are allowed. If you pass a negative value the quantity of that item will be decremented. If the quantity ever hits zero that item will be removed from the shopping cart.

Parameters:
item - The item you would like to add to the shopping cart.
quantityToAdd - The quantity amount you would like to add for this item.

addItem

void addItem(CartItem item,
             long newQuantity,
             boolean autoRecalculate)
Adds an item to our shopping cart with the given quantitiy.

Parameters:
item - The CartItem to add
newQuantity - The additional quantity to add to the cart.
autoRecalculate - Boolean specifying if we should automatically recalculate the subtotal, taxtotal, and grand total.
If you pass false we will not update the total calculations in the cart until you explicitly call .recalculate()

removeItem

void removeItem(CartItem item)
Remove this item completely from the cart.

Parameters:
item - Which CartItem to remove.

getBuilder

ShoppingCart.Builder getBuilder()
Of dubious use. TODO: determine if this stays or goes.

Returns:

recalculate

void recalculate()
Cause the shopping cart to recalculate its subtotal, tax total, and grand total. Normally this is done internally when an item is added or removed. However, if you change the price of an item that was previously added you'll need to call recalculate or the shopping cart totals will not be updated.

getCopy

ShoppingCart getCopy()
Returns a copy of this shopping cart.

Allows you to set the shipping charges for this cart.

Parameters:
